intro: Chabraea glabra, commonly known as the smooth chabraea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
